definition: to argue needlessly/to waste time explaining
to whistle down the wind/to waste one's breath (idiom)

sentences.english: I figured the store would give us guff about exchanging it.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得要想把床退回去恐怕要费一番唇舌。

sentences.english: Governments waste a lot of breath on their plans to make the economy more competitive.
sentences.chinese: 政府在使经济更具竞争性方面的计划白费了很多唇舌。

sentences.english: The spirit of the Lord hath spoken by me and his word by my tongue.
sentences.chinese: 上主的神藉著我说话，他的话语在我唇舌上。

sentences.english: My mouth shall meditate truth, and my lips shall hate wickedness.
sentences.chinese: 的确，我的口只畅谈真理，我厌恶虚诈的唇舌。

sentences.english: We had a little difficulty putting our ideas over to them.
sentences.chinese: 我们费了一番唇舌才使他们接受了我们的意见。

sentences.english: I'm not going to waste any more words on the subject.
sentences.chinese: 我不想在这个问题上多费唇舌了。

sentences.english: Of the fruit of a man's mouth shall his belly be satisfied: and the offspring of his lips shall fill him.
sentences.chinese: 人必以口中果实充满肚腹，必饱尝自己唇舌的出产。

sentences.english: My words are from my upright heart, and my lips shall speak a pure sentence.
sentences.chinese: 我的话是出于正直的心，我的唇舌要清楚说明真理。

sentences.english: It‘s no use talking to him , you‘ll only waste your breath.
sentences.chinese: 和谈谈话没有一点用处，你只是在白费唇舌。

sentences.english: In the multitude of words there shall not want sin: but he that refraineth his lips is most wise.
sentences.chinese: 多言难免无过，明智的人必约束自己的唇舌。

definition: dispute or misunderstanding caused by gossip/to talk sb round
lit. lips and teeth (idiom); fig. close partners/interdependent
to tangle with/to get involved/to pester
to provoke/to entice/to lure/to tantalize/to tease/to titillate
